content.description:
Figure 1. Effect of exercise on blood prolactin levels in adult males. The data represent the means ±2SEx̄ .

Researchers conducted a study to investigate the effect of exercise on the release of prolactin into the blood. The researchers measured the concentration of prolactin in the blood of eight adult males before (T = 0 hour) and after one hour (T = 1 hour) of vigorous exercise. As a control, the researchers measured the concentration of blood prolactin in the same group of individuals at the same times of day one week later, but without having them exercise. The results are shown in Figure 1.
content.question: Using evidence from the specific treatments, determine whether prolactin release changes after exercise. Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: Using evidence from the specific treatments, determine whether prolactin release changes after exercise. Justify your answer.

skill.text: 5.B: Use confidence intervals and error bars to estimate whether sample means are statistically different.
